channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Catherine O’Hara, ‘Home Alone’ and ‘Schitt’s Creek’ Actress, Dies at 71
item.description: An Emmy-winning comedian with oddball charm, she got her start with the influential Canadian sketch comedy series “SCTV.”

item.title: 3 big hurdles undermine Trump’s plan to extract Greenland’s mineral wealth—and America’s fraying relationship with Europe is one of them
item.description: Few friends, local politics and logistical challenges make mining in Greenland extra challenging.

item.title: Co-Stars and Fans Pay Tribute to Catherine O’Hara
item.description: Videos and photos filled social media as fans shared their favorite scenes from O’Hara’s acting career and co-stars memorialized her.

item.title: Five years after the short squeeze, GameStop’s CEO is betting on a ‘genius or totally foolish’ $100 billion-plus acquisition
item.description: CEO Ryan Cohen stands to receive $35 billion if he successfully delivers a $100 billion market capitalization for the company.

item.title: Federal Judge Drops Death Penalty Charge Against Luigi Mangione
item.description: Judge Margaret Garnett of Federal District Court dismissed two charges against Luigi Mangione, including one that carried the death penalty.

item.title: Another ‘central casting’ central banker: Trump’s pick of Kevin Warsh fits a well-established pattern
item.description: Nearly a decade ago, Trump reportedly doubted Janet Yellen was tall enough to be Fed chair. His choice was Jerome Powell.

item.title: Right before Trump named Warsh to lead the Fed, Powell seemed to respond to some of his biggest complaints about the central bank
item.description: “I mean, if it’s just a question of using better models, bring them on. Where are they? We’ll take them.”

item.title: Exxon and Chevron decline new spending in Venezuela while taking a wait-and-see approach for the years ahead
item.description: Exxon maintains long-term interest in Venezuela despite Trump's threat to keep the company out, while Chevron aims to hike its Venezuelan volumes with...

item.title: Children Were Arrested in Iran’s Brutal Crackdown on Protests
item.description: An Iranian government official said some children had been detained, the first such acknowledgment in weeks of anti-government protests.

item.title: Panamanian Court Strikes Down Hong Kong Firm’s Canal Contract
item.description: The ruling delivers a victory to President Trump, who has said he wants the U.S. to control the canal, and a blow to the longtime ports operator, CK H...

item.title: Stock Market Takes Kevin Warsh’s Fed Nomination in Stride
item.description: Stock and bond markets were unfazed by Kevin Warsh’s nomination as the next Fed chair, with the S&P 500 lower on Friday.

item.title: Why Trump Is Going After Iran Now
item.description: As President Trump warns that “we have a lot of very big, very powerful ships sailing to Iran right now,” our national security correspondent David E....

item.title: Trump Moves to Cut All Oil to Cuba as U.S. Targets Its Government
item.description: President Trump’s threat to impose tariffs on any country that delivers oil to Cuba appeared to be directed largely at Mexico, the only nation that ha...

item.title: Drilling Through the Thwaites Glacier for Clues to Its Melting
item.description: A team hopes to place instruments in the waters beneath the colossal Thwaites Glacier, with the help of a drill that uses hot water to punch through i...

item.title: Kevin Warsh, Trump’s Choice for Fed Chair Could Find It Difficult to Deliver
item.description: Kevin M. Warsh, whom Mr. Trump tapped to become the next chair of the Federal Reserve, could face fierce resistance if he tries to pursue substantiall...
